name: Hotel Palomar Philadelphia - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: From the moment the taxi pulled up to the front door, I knew I had made a great decision by staying at the Palomar. The valet and bellman were extremely nice, helpful and greeted me with a smile on their face and believe me, after dealing with airports, TSA and cramped flights, that is the first thing I want to see when I arrive to my destination. All of the folks at the front desk went above and beyond to help me get adjusted, answer any questions and recommend local restaurants based on the type of cuisine I was in the mood for. They even went so far as to print out menus to some of their favorite restaurants! All the staff seemed genuinely happy and excited to be working at the Palomar and helping each and every guest - you certainly don't mind waiting in line when you know you are going to get superb customer service. The room was amazing - the perfect mix of modern, chic and homey. It's the little things in life that count and I was extremely impressed with the dimmer switch on the bathroom lights. I loved the decorations and furnishing used in the room and immediately said to myself, 'this is my kind of hotel' as I entered the room. I was traveling alone but the room was more than spacious and I thoroughly enjoyed all of the counter space in the bathroom! The workout facility was immaculately clean and quite up-to-date regarding the fitness equimpment that was offered. The staff at Square 1682 was extremely pleasant and very accomodating as well, checking to make sure that my meal was prepared to my liking and I was happy with not only my stay at the hotel but in the city of Philadelphia as well. To say that I was impressed is an understand and I look forward to visiting the Palomar upon my next trip back to Philadelphia.
reviews.title: Palomar Philadelphia - Home Away from Home

reviews.text: Location location location! Just off Ritten Sq and easy access to all other parts of the city (walking distance to the train station). The hotel is trendy and very well presented. The lobby is very fashionable. The room perfectly laid out and spacious. Look in the closet for the bathrobes - very eclectic. If I come back to Philly I will stay here again. And will definitely be looking up the Kimpton Collection when visiting other cities. I'm a fan!!!
reviews.title: Excellent location! A great hotel for a city getaway

reviews.text: From the moment I pulled up at valet everything went right, and was right with the hotel. Great staff throughout. Jonathan the porter was super friendly and helpful, the ladies at reception were lovely. Wine offered on arrival was good and well needed. King city view room was beautifully designed, great space, clean and had everything I needed, including an umbrella for the pouring rain. Bathroom with bath/shower was perfect and I loved the colour scheme. Restaurant cuisine was divine and the wait staff had good recommendations. I love the whole ambiance, of the hotel, the relaxed atmosphere and extremely professional yet warm manor you are treated as a guest. I used the fitness centre which had everything I needed for my morning workout. And the lifts (elevators) are fab! I would definitely stay again when in the area and recommend it to others. Th perfect 4 star hotel. Only problem was I was only in town one night!
reviews.title: Love everything about it!

reviews.text: From the moment that my cab pulled up to the curb, the staff was fantastic. I arrived early but the front desk staff was happy to accommodate me. I was offered refreshments while we completed the check in. The room was spacious and comfortable. I was happy to notice that the entire hotel was very clean and well maintained. Every encounter that I had, with hotel staff, was pleasant. Free WIFI was easy to access and the mini bar, in the room, was fantastic. It had everything from water and beer to bandages and Tylenol. The Hotel Palomar is a top notch hotel in a great location, within Philadelphia, and has the kindest, nicest staff. I look forward to my next visit.
reviews.title: Hospitality at it's finest......great hotel.

reviews.text: The guys at Palomar thought on every small detail
reviews.title: Best city hotel

reviews.text: I was excited to stay at the Philadelphia Sofitel. Had a very positive experience there a couple of years ago. The reviews of the Sofitel still rate it top-notch. However, when reading the reviews from fellow travelers on TA about Hotel Palomar, I was intrigued by the overwhelmingly positive reviews. On the particular night of our stay, the Palomar was 30% cheaper than the Sofitel, so I decided to give it a try. I did not regret it.
reviews.title: Great Experience and Great Location!

reviews.text: The staff was ingratiating from the start. I told them I was traveling with my family. They had a free wine hour which we just missed, but they offered us vouchers for the bar upon arrival. They also gave us a complimentary movie and a $10 credit at the mini bar. To top it off, my son had a birthday and when we returned from dinner, there was a card and a piece of cake. They even sent cookies for our other children.
reviews.title: A+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a member of Kimpton Hotels (which is free). With membership, you get free wifi. I also think it qualified me from some of these extras.
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic location

reviews.text: The only negative is parking which is $38 a night. Not unusual for this part of town. There are garages a few blocks away that are more reasonable.
reviews.title: We plan on staying in other Kimpton Hotels---we took the directory! And I have never written a review before!

reviews.text: I still love the Sofitel which is directly across the street, but I've found a new hotel which is every bit as good. Both are great...it all comes down to price.
reviews.title: Super Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I loved this hotel; it was the perfect place to celebrate our anniversary. The art deco finishes are gorgeous and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Even though it was after check-in time when we arrived, we had to wait several hours for our room, and the staff was very apologetic about it, and made amends by offering us 4 vouchers for cocktails at the restaurant, valued up to $13 each. Turned out, the room was worth waiting for. We stayed in a spa king, which had the most amazing jetted tub and shower combination I've ever seen. I took multiple pictures of it so we could remember what it looked like for when we build our dream house someday. The location was perfect as far as access to restaurants, bars, nightlife and all the other stuff we came to Philadelphia to experience. We didn't bring our dog this time, but it was nice to know that she was welcome if we come back in the future. It can be hard to find a hotel that will let you bring a large dog. And if you are bringing a pet, there is a great park to walk them in just a few blocks away. Overall, we loved our stay and would love to come back. In the future when we travel, we will be on the look out for other Kimpton hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect room in the perfect location

reviews.text: Before the critical review - let me say that the valets and busboys were REALLY great...accommodating, friendly and knowledgeable as were the ladies covering the front desk the morning we left. Really good with the children, knowledgeable and accommodating.
reviews.title: Disappointing: Room, cleanliness, service. Not the usual Kimpton standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ..now for the rest of it. We like Kimpton hotels. We REALLY like Kimpton hotels so we try and stay in a Kimpton if there is one in a city we travel to. The service is always really good, rooms are usually great and food of high quality. They're a little trendy, but with that friendly edge that takes them above the usual hotels and always look after the children. This was our first stay at the Kimpton Palomar Philadelphia. We arrived a late after a long day. (10.20 pm) The general restaurant was shut and the bar open. Having children with us, we didn't want to bother the bar staff with catering to us, so we asked the front desk whether we could have food for the children in the room and what sort of food we could order...we were told we could have anything on the regular room service menu and order anything from the drinks menu (I did mention I was in need of an ice-cold martini aswell)!! The front desk told us that the room menu was more extensive than the bar menu so it would work better for the children. Going to the room, it seemed a little "tired" even though the hotel only opened in October 2009. There weren't enough towels and the carpeting around the bathroom was frayed. The room lighting was poor and the bathroom was just not what you'd normally expect from a Kimpton. It felt a little drab and not 100% clean but we were tired and hungry so I put it down to being tired rather than the room. Calling down to room service - we tried to order food and were told it was too late - we couldn't have anything. We said "anything for the children will do..even a plate of fries"..but were told we couldn't have anything and that it was too late for milk and cookies even. We got to the 'almost begging' stage and told the room service/restaurant guy that the front desk had assured us we could get anything from the menu - but we were told 'no". I asked whether they could do a plate of cold fruit?..'no'. So we were forced to raid the mini bar...which would have been okay..IF someone else's half-eaten food (including fresh garlic dips...NOT fresh anymore) weren't in the mini-bar! (Hmm..why wasn't this checked when the room was cleaned previously)???? Dinner for the children ended up being 1 bar of chocolate, 1 bag of chips and a bottle of orange juice.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even took a while to10 minutes get up to the room..as 2 of the 4 elevators were stuck at basement level and wouldn't move..so there was quite a line to get into the 2 small elevators that were working (for a large hotel of 19 floors..this was a little concerning). Bathroom shower pressure was VERY poor.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business or pleasure

reviews.text: The next morning we went for breakfast which is in the restaurant which is situated above the bar. We were the only table and service even then was quite slow. The staff (in the restaurant and bar that morning) were more interested in chatting amongst themselves rather than attending to the one table in use. We had to ask for coffee refills on 4 occasions as the coffee was not replenished without asking. The breakfast menu is limited but okay - however the quality of the food is very poor. We were given 3 cold, hard mini-muffins which were obviously straight from the fridge. 2 of us ordered waffles with fruit and they came quite hard, and were very dry (which I don't know how you manage with fresh waffles). The fruit consisted of 4 tiny strawberries and a few blueberries which seemed as though they had been sitting around for a while. Breakfast for four ..two of whom were children (which was 2 orders of waffles, one of fruit, a side of bacon and an omlette, with the coffee and orange juice..came to $100). Not acceptable for bad food and disinterested service.
reviews.title: Beautiful room and incredibly friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a 3 city tour of the US we landed in Philly and were amazed at the attention to detail and the quality of the Hotel Palomar.
reviews.title: Service and Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, a few days before we arrived, we received an email from the hotel with offers to upgrade the room for a VERY reasonable amount. We took it! It upgraded us from a City View King with 1 King Bed to a King Suite.
reviews.title: The Perfect "Mini-cation"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very courteous. Every member of staff introduces themselves, every member of staff was helpful. That immediately made us feel welcome and at home.
reviews.title: Overnight in Philly

reviews.text: The room itself was superb. Highest quality in every regard, from the very tasteful decor and carpet to the amenities:
reviews.title: Hip, not pretentious

reviews.text: - great view
reviews.title: The Palomar is an inviting place to stay with excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent the weekend of August 14th at the Hotel Palomar for a quick getaway. We have stayed at other Phila hotels, but Palomar by far the best. From the moment the Valet took our car, we knew this hotel was going to be a good one! Check in a breeze with extremely courteous staff. The room was very contemporary, clean, bright and very attractive with a soaking tub that was incredibly huge. The location is just perfect..easy walk to almost everything. We walked to the nearby Mutter Museum which, by the way, is a one of a kind physicians museum and a must see for those who are interested in the unusual! The Palormar offered a complimentary one hour wine tasting in the lobby area which was a great place to mix with guests. Then on to the bar in the hotel which was friendly and upscale. The entire hotel just had a really good feel about it and we are looking forward to going back in the near future.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Philly

reviews.text: Clean, modern, perfect location. Staff ultra-friendly. Will stay again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Excellent Location, Good Value

reviews.text: I would gladly stay here again when visiting Philadelphia. It far exceeded my expectations. Kudos to the staff.
reviews.title: Terrific - exceeded expectations

reviews.text: The lobby is beautiful as is the elevators and hallways. The room was beautiful and one of my favourite things was how good the blinds were. It may seem silly but I like it to be pitch black and the Palomar did great here. The room was like brand new and very clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Its in a nice location with many shops and restaurants right there at the front door. Really enjoyed my short time there.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay while in Philly. Location is fantastic for dinning and nightlife. Parking is tight, but the hotel does have valet for around $40/night. The standard room is a little on the smallish size so I reccomend, if possible upgrade to a suite.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I'm a Kimpton fan. Just passing through Philly I chose to stay here even though it was a little more expensive than competing hotels because of a special free parking option. This chain, for those who aren't familiar, offers a striking contrast to the bland options of major chains. Decor is bold and appealing, staff is much better trained at customer service, little perks (room upgrades, coupons for minibar, free wifi, newspapers even on Sunday, wine hour) Kimpton members really do make a big difference.
reviews.title: cool hotel just off Rittenhouse Square

reviews.text: This particular site offers spectacular views from higher floors and is just steps from all the dining and shopping options of Rittenhouse Square and Walnut Street. It is also in walking distance to City Hall/Reading Terminal, and for those who like walking the city, the art museum and and the historic landmarks located closer to the river.
reviews.title: Love this place...will definitely be back!

reviews.text: We stayed a few months back at the Kimpton's Monaco, located near Independence Hall, and thought the experience could not be equalled - but Palomar is just as good.
reviews.title: Good Boutique Hotel
Great hotel
reviews.text: Exceptional front desk staff. Very professional and friendly staff throughout. I had stayed at another facility the night before and it wasn't quite what I had hoped, so I booked a room for the next night at the Palomar Philly. Because I'd be checking out of one facility and into the Palomar, I called to inquire about early check-in or paying a day rate. They were incredibly accommodating and as spaced permitted, they allowed me to check in at 10:30am. At check in, they even expressed regret that my experience at the other hotel had been unsatisfactory. Free wifi with guest rewards membership. Complimentary wine tasting in evening. Very relaxing ambiance. I am actually looking forward to visiting Philadelphia again just so I can stay here!

I stayed for 3 nights in June 2013. This Hotel has some great plus points and a few areas they could improve upon. I'm lucky to have stayed in some great hotels, so you may think I'm being a bit picky!
reviews.title: Hotel Palomar in Philadelphia ROCKS!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last minute trip to Philly with the Husband for our anniversary. Not only did they upgrade our room to a city view but we also returned to chocolate covered strawberries and wine with a card wishing us well! Couldn't be more impressed. Rooms were exceptionally clean and staff was more than willing to go out their way to impress. I hope that they can keep it up since it is such a new location for them. Plan to stay at more Kimpton's in the future for sure.
reviews.title: First time at a Kimpton, very impressed

reviews.text: Had a great time at Hotel Palomar. The location is fantastic and the staff superb. Everything was thoroughly explained during check-in including the Arnold Palmer hour and wine tasting hour. They offered to give recommendations for dinner and nightlife and was very helpful in aiding us find a place for sushi. The bar was a buzz and the bartenders happy and fun! The room was very clean, we had a room with tub and it was fantastic to relax in at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Couldn't of asked for more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and look forward to staying here again in the near future!
reviews.title: Believe the hype!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I travelled to Philly for a last minute summer vacation for five days. We are very loyal Kimpton hotel guests and when that option is available, we take advantage and prefer them over all others. The hotel is a very new addition to the Kimpton family, but offered all the amenities and charm of all the others we have visited. The Palomar was very centrally located in the heart of the city. We are very big walkers and were able to get to all the major and minor sites from the hotel no problem. Everything is within a 2 mile radius of the hotel. You can walk to incredible restaurants in any part of the city from the hotel as well. The staff are very helpful and take a genuine interest in their guests to make sure everything is exceeding their expectations. The rooms are well appointed with everything you could need.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Location, GREAT MASSAGES!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition, the wine reception, morning coffee/tea bar and afternoon refreshments were a great perk while exploring the city in the summer. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to enjoy Philadelphia in the heart of the action.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel, but Room Service is a Hot Mess

reviews.text: We just love staying at all of the Kimpton hotels, and the Palomar in Philadelphia is no exception. The staff, room, and service are just perfect and welcoming. We once spent several days at the Palomar when a hurricane forced is to evacuate our home, and we felt like we were at home. Wherever we travel, if there is a Kimpton in town, that is where we stay.
reviews.title: Always perfect

reviews.text: We stay here every time we come to Philadelphia. The location can't be beat. The staff are incredibly thoughtful and helpful. And the rooms are a nice size. Fitness center also great always the perfect stay. The pet-friendly aspect makes for an additional plus.
reviews.title: Perfect location, wonderful staff

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel...
reviews.title: Palomar Philly - Stay Here!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's in Center City - perfect location
reviews.title: Excellent location AND service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly staff from check-in to check-out!
reviews.title: AMAZING Staff and a Great Hotel!

description: Hotel Palomar Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel, is the first LEED Gold Certified luxury hotel in the heart of Center City is a testament to superior eco-friendly hotel design, personalized service and genuinely warm hospitality. Hotel Palomar is a unique luxury boutique hotel that features a striking lobby, the critically acclaimed Square 1682 restaurant and on-site fitness center. Throughout our boutique hotel, original artwork dynamically interacts with soft hues, luxurious custom furnishings and original architectural detailing.
